medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 18 months earlier when he developed a foot abscess treated with surgical d√©bridement. He then experienced a right popliteal deep venous thrombosis treated with warfarin. Following these illnesses, he felt chronically fatigued and reduced physical activity but returned to work. Eight months before admission, he resumed working out and playing tennis but tired easily. Six months before admission, he developed right shoulder pain which spread to the left shoulder, diagnosed as bilateral shoulder impingement syndrome. Four months prior, he fell, injuring his right hamstring, and reported legs feeling like jelly. Two months before admission, he required assistance rising from a seated position; around that time, he started on imipramine for urinary incontinence which led to increased fatigue, shuffling gait, and slurred speech. Three weeks before admission, he began to stumble, and two days before, he collapsed and was unable to rise.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hyperlipidemia, radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer eight years prior, and urinary stress incontinence.
medical_history.social_history: He lived with family and worked full-time as an executive. He had a history of heavy smoking until 25 years prior and alcohol consumption until 14 years prior.
